definitions.definition: A piece of music for one or more solo instruments and orchestra.
A thin board on which a painter lays and mixes colours.

Showing a degree of correspondence or similarity.
To change the culture of (a person) by the influence of another culture, especially a more advanced culture.
To cause (a person) to acquire the culture of society, starting at birth.
To be changed by acculturation.
Showing anger or indignation, especially at something unjust or wrong.
A saint conceived as the patron (protector or supporter) of a particular place, group, or activity.
definitions.example: St. Patrick is the patron saint of Ireland; St. Isidore is the patron saint of software engineers; and St. Anthony is the patron saint of travelers and finding lost things.

definitions.definition: An exemplar: an individual who exemplifies some trait or group.
definitions.example: Janet is the patron saint of procrastination. I'm thinking of erecting her a shrine of doughnut boxes in the breakroom.

definitions.definition: To regard with contempt or scorn.
To disregard or ignore.
A Japanese martial art using "swords" of split bamboo.

The leaves of these plants used in flavouring food.
Loose clothing in which one can lounge.
One who grinds something, such as the teeth.

A power tool with a spinning abrasive disc, used for grinding, smoothing, and shaping materials, usually metal.
A sandwich made on a long, cylindrical roll.

definitions.definition: A kitchen gadget for processing coffee, herbs etc. into small or powdered pieces

An outdoor space for drills and parades.
A European bird (Coloeus monedula) of the crow family, often nesting in church towers and ruins.
A Daurian jackdaw, a closely related Asian bird (Coloeus dauuricus).
To concentrate toward the essence by making more close, compact, or dense, thereby decreasing size or volume.

definitions.definition: To transform from a gaseous state into a liquid state via condensation.

definitions.definition: Condensed; compact; dense.
A finely-laid, close-mown and rolled stretch of lawn for playing the game of bowls.
Something which amuses, and serves to make time pass agreeably.

definitions.definition: To sport; to amuse oneself
Expressing a sudden desire for silence.
A title given to a saint, often prefixed to the person's name.

definitions.definition: Someone connected with any of the sports teams known as the Saints, as a fan, player, coach etc.
Saint class, a class of steam locomotives used on the GWR.
A condition; a set of circumstances applying at any given time.
High social standing or circumstance.
A polity.
(stochastic processes) An element of the range of the random variables that define a random process.
(grammar) The lexical aspect (aktionsart) of verbs or predicates that do not change over time.

An arrangement of stitches in sewing, or method of stitching in some particular way or style.

definitions.definition: An intense stabbing pain under the lower edge of the ribcage, brought on by exercise.
A single turn of the thread round a needle in knitting; a link, or loop, of yarn

definitions.definition: An arrangement of stitches in knitting, or method of knitting in some particular way or style.
A space of work taken up, or gone over, in a single pass of the needle.
A fastening, as of thread or wire, through the back of a book to connect the pages.
(by extension) Any space passed over; distance.

definitions.definition: A contortion, or twist.
Any least part of a fabric or dress.

definitions.definition: A furrow.
The space between two double furrows.
A hard earthen substance that can form large rocks.
A small piece of stone, a pebble.
A gemstone, a jewel, especially a diamond.
(plural: stone) A unit of mass equal to 14 pounds. Used to measure the weights of people, animals, cheese, wool, etc. 1 stone ≈ 6.3503 kilograms
The central part of some fruits, particularly drupes; consisting of the seed and a hard endocarp layer.

definitions.definition: A hard, stone-like deposit.

definitions.definition: A playing piece made of any hard material, used in various board games such as backgammon, and go.
A dull light grey or beige, like that of some stones.
A 42-pound, precisely shaped piece of granite with a handle attached, which is bowled down the ice.
A monument to the dead; a gravestone or tombstone.
A mirror, or its glass.
A testicle of an animal.

A place where items may be accumulated or routinely kept.

definitions.definition: A supply held in storage.
(mainly North American) A place where items may be purchased; a shop.

definitions.definition: Memory.

definitions.definition: A great quantity or number; abundance.
A paved part of road, usually in a village or a town.

definitions.definition: The people who live in such a road, as a neighborhood.

An illicit or contraband source, especially of drugs.

definitions.definition: Streetwise slang.
A great distance.

definitions.definition: Each of the three opportunities that players have to bet, after the flop, turn and river.
Living in the streets.

A program that provides services to other programs or devices, either in the same computer or over a computer network.

definitions.definition: The enjoyment derived from a possession.

definitions.definition: An image, symbol, picture, or other representation usually as an object of religious devotion.

definitions.definition: A small picture that represents something (such as an icon on a computer screen which when clicked performs some function.)

An implement with a handle connected to a round frame strung with wire, sinew, or plastic cords, and used to hit a ball, such as in tennis, or a shuttlecock in badminton.

To dart about in a manner reminiscent of a ball hit by a racquet.

definitions.definition: A mark on any scale of measurement; a unit of measurement.

definitions.definition: A jiffy (unit of time defined by basic timer frequency).

definitions.definition: A push, stab, or lunge forward (the act thereof.)

definitions.definition: The force generated by propulsion, as in a jet engine.
